name: St. Mari

locations.description: Disciple of Addai, Bishop of Seleucia-Ctesiphon

summary: Mari was a disciple of Addai (Thaddeus) and is considered one of the founders of the Church of the East in Mesopotamia. According to the Doctrine of Addai, he was sent by Addai to evangelize the region around Seleucia-Ctesiphon. He became the second Bishop of Seleucia-Ctesiphon and is venerated as a saint in the Syriac Christian tradition. His mission helped establish Christianity in the Persian Empire.
